docs.title: High performance ADC
docs.text: Apr. 2022 - Present, in ShanghaiTech University.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• Built a SAR ADC model including sampling jitter, thermal noise, mismatch and incomplete settling.
  • Proposed a gain-boosting dynamic comparator featuring a modified pre-amplifier with positive feedback and static current cut-off circuit.
  • Designed an asynchronous SAR logic maximizing CDAC settling time and has low circuit complexity.
  • Implemented a 12-bit 100 MS/s SAR ADC utilizing the proposed comparator and SAR logic.
  • Customized circuit layout with area and mismatch optimization.
  • Fabricated in 28-nm CMOS, set up testing system with dedicated PCB and FPGA control program.

docs.title: Cryogenic circuit design and testing
docs.text: Jul. 2021 - 2022, in ShanghaiTech University.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• Simulated CMOS circuit operation down to 10K using cryogenic compact model.
  • Implemented a 5-bit flash ADC using cryogenic modeled PDK, fabricated in 40-nm CMOS.
  • Cryogenic circuit test and evaluation using liquid helium dewar.

docs.title: Dynamic bias optimization for MRAM
docs.text: Jun. 2022 - Present, in ShanghaiTech University.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• Quantified the optimal read bias voltage of MRAM cell, in reference with measured results.
  • Designed a dynamic bias optimization circuit (DBO) that can track the optimal read bias voltage in background, with respect to a wide range of process variation and thermal conditions.
  • Simulated the proposed DBO with 1-Mb MRAM array, using 28-nm PDK and Verilog-A MRAM model.
